page.title: 09MR. BLUNDELL 2
page.content:
Mr Blundell walked to Padiham for piano lessons and organ lessons but he had no other hobbies. His only toy was a top and whip. He sometimes walked to Padiham to the pictures. It cost one shilling (5p) to get in.
Mr Blundell joined the army and served in Africa, travelling on a luxury liner in a convoy to avoid the enemy. After the war he had a motor bike until he fell off it, then he got a motor car in 1947.
He was the grave digger, organist and caretaker at the church and school until he retired. He still plays the piano in school and the church organ.
